channel.title: Vertigo - Runetek 1
channel.description:
Javacisnotrecognized was able to dig up a copy of Jagex's old Vertigo game. It was released on gamesdomain around 1999, so it has the Runetek 1 engine in it. It's a reasonably fun game, and the source code is even more fun to look through.
Here's a picture of vertigo: [img]http://jaghax.ws/vertigo/vertigo.png[/img]
Copyrighted 1999: [img]http://jaghax.ws/vertigo/startup.png[/img]
I have more pictures [url=http://jaghax.ws/vertigo/]here[/url]. You can download it [url=http://jaghax.ws/vertigo/vertigo.zip]here[/url].
One particularly neat thing about this game is that it's source code was obfuscated, versus the class files being obfuscated. Thus, the original source file names were still located inside the class files that _^_ recovered, and jad included them in the comments of the decompiled Java files.
Anyway, it's runetek 1 and we have the source for it. :P
Edit: You can play the game [url=http://jaghax.ws/vertigo/applet/]here[/url].

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:10, topic:309052”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=405502.msg2998943#msg2998943 date=1255814001]
so why is this in the inside section
[/quote]

I imagine if Jagex sees their ancient games getting downloaded, decompiled, and posted everywhere they will have them taken down. After I finish collecting all of them this won’t matter though, so then I’ll release them publicly.[/quote]

Seems like a good enough reason to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Vertigo - Runetek 1
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I plan to dig up as many of the old games as I can; unfortunately internet archive will randomly decide not to load some file, so getting every piece is annoying. It’s amazing looking through this and seeing how much code is almost identical to code in RS2 (Pixmap, GameShell, etc are virtually unchanged). It creates a really simple way to write a game for the engine.

Read full topic
